text: End of the Century () is an Argentine romantic drama film, directed by Lucio Castro and released in 2019.Glenn Kenny, "‘End of the Century’ Review: A Vacation Veers Into Existential States". The New York Times, August 15, 2019. The film stars Juan Barberini as Ocho, a man from Argentina on vacation in Barcelona, who hooks up for a casual sexual encounter with Javi, played by Ramon Pujol. The men soon realize that they have met before, 20 years earlier in 1999, when they were both in the closet about their sexuality and too afraid to pursue a relationship with each other.Keith Uhlich, "'End of the Century': Film Review | New Directors/New Films 2019". The Hollywood Reporter, March 30, 2019. The film also stars Mía Maestro as Sonia, Javi's girlfriend at the time of the original meeting. The film had its theatrical premiere at the New Directors/New Films Festival on March 30, 2019.Jude Dry, "‘End of the Century’ Trailer: Swooning Gay Romance Is the Argentine Answer to ‘Weekend’". IndieWire, July 17, 2019. It subsequently had its Argentine premiere on April 8 at the Buenos Aires International Festival of Independent Cinema, where it won the award for Best Argentine Film."BAFICI 2019: “The Unicorn” y “Fin de siglo” fueron las grandes ganadoras". Otros Cines, April 13, 2019. It subsequently screened at other LGBT and general interest film festivals, and won the award for Best First Feature at the Frameline Film Festival.John Seal, "Big Screen Berkeley: ‘End of the Century’ and ‘Britt-Marie Was Here’". Berkeleyside, September 26, 2019. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2019 films Category:Argentine films Category:Argentine romantic drama films Category:Argentine LGBT-related films Category:2019 LGBT-related films Category:LGBT-related romantic drama films Category:Films set in Barcelona Category:2019 romantic drama films Category:2019 drama films
title: End of the Century (film)
